intro: Diplotaxis brassicoides var. intermedia, commonly known as the African mustard or wild rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped, glaucous leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in spring and summer. Its seeds are enclosed in hairy, triangular pods and are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
